page.title: 12PRIMARY SCHOOL, SADDLEWORTH
page.content: St. Chad's C. E. Primary School is a single storey building of pre-cast concrete structure with large windows and a flat roof.It is typical of the buildings of that era, but contrasts markedly with older stone buildings in Saddleworth Fold. It is a sign of changing times, & in the 1980's would possibly have been planned differently again because of the current trend to design buildings 'in keeping' with the character of the area. The school has 210 pupils of primary age, & 7 staff including Mrs. Bernice Magson, the first headmistress of the new school. Its curriculum is modern, open-plan. It caters for children from farms, working-class backgrounds & middle- class commuters. It is of 'Controlled' status with expenses met by Oldham Borough Council. Chairman of the Board of Governors is Vicar of St. Chad's.
